messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] blog name suggestions?
messages.msgSnippet: I d recommend you pick an easy address for you blog - regardless of the blog title. i.e. Hahamommy.blogspot.com is easy, I *am* hahamommy, though the blog is
messages.messageBody:
I'd recommend you pick an easy address for you blog - regardless of
the blog title. i.e. Hahamommy.blogspot.com is easy, I *am* hahamommy,
though the blog is actually titled 'The Journey of Nani Moon'
You could pick some thing easy like
nicolesmusings.whateverblogsource.com and then play with titles until
you find one that sticks!
~diana
hannahbearski.blogspot.com

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] blog name suggestions?
messages.msgSnippet: DD suggested home rules ...which is nice Then we started talking about how we dont stay home all the time :) Then we started talking about how someone might go
messages.messageBody:
DD suggested home rules ...which is nice

Then we started talking about how we dont stay home all the time :)

Then we started talking about how someone might go looking for some sort of set of house rules or scheduling or something like managers of their homes and end up on our blog.


Nicole

Don't worry that children never listen to you : worry that they are always watching you--Robert Fulghum



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] blog name suggestions?
messages.msgSnippet: I have been thinking of starting my first family blog and have been mulling over names. I m trying to find something that has meaning for me and my family (as
messages.messageBody:
I have been thinking of starting my first family blog and have been
mulling over names. I'm trying to find something that has meaning for
me and my family (as opposed to just me). I'm going back to places
we've been, books, songs, movies, tv shows and computer games we've
all enjoyed together for inspiration, but haven't settled on anything
yet. I'm making a list.

I have a feeling when the right one pops up, I'll know it, somehow. I
don't want to overthink it (something I am prone to do <g>).

Don't know if that helps :-)

Robin B.

messages.messageBody:
I'm starting a new blog after taking a little break to think :)

Im half thininking of just doing finding the wonderful again and half thinking of going with a whole new name but I just cant think of anything right now.

Any suggestions?


Nicole

Don't worry that children never listen to you : worry that they are always watching you--Robert Fulghum
